content: com/shorts/duglhmgxftm if you would like a more in depth explanation there is a longer video on my channel about this when you complete the colorwork section turn the sock right side out again to continue knitting the rest of the sock ● my other tip for these colorwork sections is to make sure the stitches stay spread out on your right hand needle or left hand needle for mirror knitters as you knit this also encourages your floats to stay long ● try on your sock after completing the colorwork band on the leg to make sure it fits ● if you make the leg of your sock much longer than my sample there is a possibility you might need to go up a needle size for the colorwork section on the leg but this is highly individual and depends on the size and shape of your leg directions cuff for the mc+2ccs version use cc1 for the cuff for the mc+1cc version use cc for the cuff using a german twisted cast on cast on 56 64 72 stitches join to knit in the round place stitch marker to mark bor knit 16 rounds of k1 p1 ribbing note i like to put pattern and color jogs on the back of the sock where it is less noticeable therefore that s where the beginning of round will end up if you are using the magic loop or the two circulars method you may wish to rearrange your stitches so that the beginning of round sits in the middle of one needle while the other needle holds all the stitches for the front of the sock this will keep the needle change and any possible wonky stitches or laddering on the sides of the sock rather than down the front ©jenniferbeaulieu2024 the mc+2ccs version use cc2 for the background and cc1 for the motif for the mc+1cc version use mc for the background and cc for the motif knit the chart you picked a total of 7 8 9 times around the leg for a total of 56 64 72 stitches after completing chart cut cc s with mc knit 40 rounds or until reaching desired leg length move on to heel ©jenniferbeaulieu2024 patternforpersonaluseonly
